intro: Calea cacosmoides, commonly known as the "flower of the night," is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that open at night and close during the day. The plant belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is known for its ornamental value. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stem is upright and branching. The plant thrives in well-drained soil and prefers full sun to partial shade.
